website_summaries.verdict: A powerful accordion-style plunger that puts tough clogs to shame. This is the plunger for those with frequent clogs.
pros: Can take care of clogs in one plunge
Fits most toilets and doesn't take a lot of strength to move water through
cons: Powerful enough to spray a lot of water if it doesn't have a good seal

customer_reviews.title: you must be careful though to make sure you have a good seal in the hole before you slam the handle ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the ultimate plunger on steroids. There is no toilet clog it can't blast through; however, you must be careful though to make sure you have a good seal in the hole before you slam the handle down. It will literally blow crap all over the room! Once you have a good seal, and know things are safe, you can put the pedal to the metal and get some serious unclogin' going ON! I think last time I used it, I heard a sewage plant worker scream for help.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Q. Public

customer_reviews.title: Best Plunger Ever
customer_reviews.text: It was worth waiting a couple of days for this to arrive. My old plunger was unable to dislodge the butt bomb that clogged my toilet and I didn't want the expense of a plumber. With just a few pumps the clog started moving and with a bit of dish soap and hot water I soon got that wonderful sound of a fully flushing toilet! I'm very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Elevator Man

customer_reviews.title: Only used it once and it instantly unclogged the bathtub
customer_reviews.text: I bought three different hair drain clog remover and it failed to unclog my bathtub. However, I only used this once and it literally unclogged the drain instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Ms60

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy construction; trashed in months
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this only 5 months ago. I don't recall ever using it, but apparently my wife had need of it. I learned yesterday that it was ripped around handle, rendering it useless. She said it had been that way at least a month, but didn't throw it away or let me know. The last plunger we had lasted decades, and saw significant usage prior to replacing our old, hard-to-flush toilet. Honestly, I wasn't happy with this plunger when I unboxed it, and now wished I had followed my instincts and sent it back. It had a flimsy feel to it, and certainly didn't hold up to even slight usage.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the best plunger for kitchen sink I've found!
customer_reviews.text: It seems a bit funny to be waxing so eloquent about a plunger though I relied on others' reviews to make my choice as I had a different item that was either defective or just useless--and this item definitely did the job. I needed one to dedicate to using in the kitchen sink/disposer, and while I've only used it once--it was evident that it was building up some power as the drain of the sink in the sink to the left had its own drain cover lift from the pressure. Happy I found this and bought it on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Only and Last plunger you'll ever need
customer_reviews.text: Plunges with the power of Thor's hammer. I have a toilet which is suffering from low-flow due to roots growing in the mainline. So until I can get it fixed, I have to occasionally use thing. 2 or 3 plunges and it's done, the accordion design really forces the air in there, once water is sucked up into the plunger, the force multiplies even more. I'll never buy another type of plunger other than this. This thing will unstop a toilet clogged by a backed-up Sumo wrestler.
customer_reviews.author: T-Rex

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: Made of a tad bit thin material, so I don't see it lasting forever, but the suction (pushing) power does the trick everytime! I have a newer toilet withe a narrow, upward flow so I couldn't get the regular pludgers to seal enough to move any clog. I live in apt's so I regularly get backed up and this has saved the day, on a bad day...lol. Just make sure to add water before you plunge, or you will get it back. I'd buy again. (I even bought my elderly mother one and she likes it for the ease of use)
customer_reviews.author: Grammyssunshine

customer_reviews.title: I love these plungers! Quality! Strength! Performance!
customer_reviews.text: I love these plungers! My other one lasted for over 15 years, no problems until someone took a blade to it and sliced it. These are so durable and strong that I know it was sabotaged because the quality is that it will last forever if you use it as directed. They just do not fall apart! I NEVER had a clog it wouldn't clear... quickly. I even used it in sinks that clogged (yes, I scoured them out and disinfected them) and it worked every time and usually with very little effort. For obvious reasons, I ordered a shorty as well for sinks.
customer_reviews.author: OneWayOnlyJesus

customer_reviews.title: This plunger is crap
customer_reviews.text: Because of its shape this plunger holds a lot of water inside the plunger so when you are done water spills all over floor. Even if you are careful and shake it out a lot of water drains out. I also found when pressing down on handle Siri’s pushed out the sides instead of down drain. A more traditional plunger is way better and effective.
customer_reviews.author: NachoForceTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: For most toilets, this product is useless garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is made from stiff plastic. It does not bend like rubber to conform to a noncircular shaped opening like those found in nearly all toilets. Consequently, it cannot make a pressure seal in those toilets and would be completely useless. I think it might be a good sink plunger. But for my toilet it is completely useless and I believe that would be true for nearly all toilets. I'm a scientist. I understand the concepts involved.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best plunger I have ever used! Our toilets get backed up pretty much every day and I, of course, dread the chore of plunging it each time. We have always had a heavy duty plunger but even then I was a hassle to use. I was quite surprised at how easy this thing was to use! The first plunge I bared down on it like I used to with the old one, only to realize that was a bit of overkill. Just a few gentle plunges and this thing clears up the worst clogs. Highly, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Threw out. Doesnt push air..almost like a hole where handle connects. Went to home depot and bought a better one same style.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The design is nice because the flexibility of the bellows allows you to ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a sink that was draining very slowly. I didn't want to buy the smaller one because I wanted one plunger that I could use for anything. This got my sink unclogged in one plunge. The design is nice because the flexibility of the bellows allows you to use it at an angle if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Oh my God!
customer_reviews.text: Never have I rushed to write a review, but this is the plunger you need! I worked on a toilet clog for long time with our old, crappy (pun intended) plungers. I eventually gave up and started researching new plungers. I settled on this one. For the last 48 hours I've suffered using the kids bathroom. (Somebody should clean that bathroom!) This one arrived a short while ago. In less than minute, clog cleared! Haven't been this happy since the Eagles won the Super Bowl. I just ordered two more for the other bathrooms and am tossing out the old ones. Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Cole

customer_reviews.title: A reliable plunger bar none.
customer_reviews.text: I only have positive comments for this product. I have bought this item many years ago, long before amazon came along. I was pleasantly surprised when I found it on amazon for sale. I bought several to make sure I had a spare and another for the second bathroom. I don't often need it but when I do it is the best plunger system on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Harris, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A PLUNGER THAT YOU WILL LIKE!
customer_reviews.text: I have TRIED to use the regular type of plunger, and this one is so much easier on my old arms to use. In fact, one of the gals that works here borrowed my plunger to use on another gals commode. I have one of the old type also, and this is the one I use for my problems. In fact, I have one of that type for my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne Judd

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Quick
customer_reviews.text: Saw a similar product on a YouTube video. This one worked as well when following the video’s instructions. Clears most clogs in less than 30 seconds in all three of our clog-prone toilets.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Marchesani

customer_reviews.title: My Hero!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived faster than a speeding bullet. It was more powerful and a locative. It flushed my toilet with only a few pushes. Look up into the sky, and what do you see? G.T. Water Products, Inc. MP100-3 Master Purpose Plunger, Handle, Black!
customer_reviews.author: essolunapapa

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, easy, low cost fix for clogs.
customer_reviews.text: Bellows plungers make quick, easy fix for clogged drains. For those 1-star reviewers, may I suggest 1. ...a series of very rapid plunges to loosen the clog; 2. ...ensuring good seal for bellows.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Jean

customer_reviews.title: Best Plunger.
customer_reviews.text: These Master Plungers are easily the best plungers you can buy. I have them at home and at my business. They surprisingly last much longer than thicker, rubber plungers and are much less strenuous to use. With about 1/10th of the force (10%), this thing will clear clogs that no traditional plunger will clear. They're also easy to clean in a mop sink or bathtub.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: plunger
customer_reviews.text: I'm 74yrs young, but I couldn't unplug my bathtub with this . I'm not strong enough, I guess..thought I didn't have to be is why I ordered it..i was wrong..i was exhausted and drain was still clogged
customer_reviews.author: lightfountain

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on my older toilet
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on my 60's toilet. Tried this on a clogged toilet and couldn't get the clog drained. Tried a regular black rubber plunger and it cleared it. Maybe this works better on new toilets.
customer_reviews.author: dudetteabides

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Worthless. Thin plastic that is unable to create suction. Fill foolish that I fell for the review that said this was a good buy. Will now buy a sturdy rubber plunger.
customer_reviews.author: Magnoliasc

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Plunger
customer_reviews.text: We just used one on our kitchen sink and it has worked very well. The second one is for our downstairs powder room ready for use. We liked their efficiency and their compactness.
customer_reviews.author: ABB

customer_reviews.title: This is THE plunger to get!
customer_reviews.text: Best plunger I've ever had! I always struggled to use regular plungers and it would take me forever to unclog the toilet. This works immediately and so easy to use. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toiet bowl plunger
customer_reviews.text: My problem with the device is getting a good seal to get the most effectiveness of the tool. The concept is great, but therre needs to be something added to ensure a better seal.
customer_reviews.author: F. William Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Best for plunging a stubborn toilet. Missing a base or container.
customer_reviews.text: This style of plunger is the most effective I've ever seen. However it does not come with a base to sit it on or other kind of container. This is the only reason why it's not getting 5 stars. This plunger can be a little unsightly. While the bellows make it clear the drain, you can't be certain all the water has drained out of it when you are done. So having at least some kind of stand to put it on would be nice. A container that hid the plunger (at least below the handle) would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing lack of oomph
customer_reviews.text: Despite tilting to fill chamber with water, it just doesn’t have that effective “ooomph” to get the job done without 3-5 tries (sometimes more). It doesn’t have the power of the rubber models with the bulbous head - those are significantly more effective to clear the drain the first time.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeBuyerTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE ITTTTT
customer_reviews.text: This baby is HEAVY DUTY on heavy dooty's... sorry, I had to. It's really an amazing plunger and I'm so happy I bought it. No longer will I have to be annoyed every two days when the crappy toilet in the new house I moved into does not properly take care of business.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t get a good seal so it doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly my opportunity to try this came the day my return window closed. It’s impossible to get a good seal so it simply does not work. Very cheaply made. They should change the design and make the nose rubber so that they can and here and make a good seal. My old rubber plunger ultimately did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: A Martin

customer_reviews.title: USA MADE POWER
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a monster. If you cant unplug it with this its not suppose to be in the pipe.
customer_reviews.author: AbeScot

customer_reviews.title: One plunge was all it took.
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem, and this fixed it, instantly upon arrival. I wonder about the negative reviews. Did those reviewers order the sink drain plunger instead, which is not designed to work in a toilet? Anyway, like I said, one plunge, and it was problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Graymauser

customer_reviews.title: Best for the Job
customer_reviews.text: I have no clue why any other type of plunger is manufactured since they don't work. I was flushing stuff from the cat box I'd scoop out down the toilet & it would get stopped up on occasion. I'd have to call in the cavalry for help before I ordered this. I'm not particularly strong & this is really easy to use & it works.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra H. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Did not do the job.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three toilet plungers as a test to get rid of a major clogged toilet. Two passed, and sorry to say, this one failed. Nice color though!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: great plunger
customer_reviews.text: Just used it today. My kitchen sink is the only slow drain in the house and it worked very well!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Fern

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this, but it just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Darling Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Works like a dream. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Blasted out my kitchen sink after slamming it down relentlessly for ten minutes. Blasted everything out of the whole line. Sink works better now than it did before. Get one of these. It is very sturdy and well-made.
customer_reviews.author: HeyCatherine

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Lasted less than 2 months before it broke. It wasn't even getting used that often. Contacted Amazon support and they sent a replacement out. The replacement broke within a couple uses as well. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: but this thing it 100x better than your standard plunger
customer_reviews.text: make sure you do a clean plunge to clean out the inside after you unclog the toilet, but this thing it 100x better than your standard plunger. however I also picked up a very similar one at home depot for $5
customer_reviews.author: SpecialK

customer_reviews.title: Has potential
customer_reviews.text: Packs a punch, but doesn't seal well on my basement shower drain (or probably anywhere) I'm buying a big rubber gasket in an attempt to make it a very effective tool. If it works I'll update post with the item number.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Easily unclog your toilet
customer_reviews.text: If you have toilet clogs and don’t want toilet clogs this is the move
customer_reviews.author: Dina L. Giovanelli

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Not very well made. After 2-3 plunges the top of the handle started breaking through. The top part collapsed inward, so it made it difficult to get a full plunge. I bought 3 of these duds. Learned my lesson, try one first before you go all out!
customer_reviews.author: Carol C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for tough clogs! Thanks to those that warned me to slowly push air out to prevent splash before using more vigorously.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing! I live in a home with two grown ...
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing! I live in a home with two grown men and three women. Needless to say everything gets clogged around here. Sinks, drains, and toilets. These plungers work amazing and unclog all of it with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Risa

customer_reviews.title: No better than my old plunger and much harder to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I used this plunger on a stopped up toilet and afterwards it is impossible to clean as there are too many nooks and crannies between all of the surfaces. Bottom line is that it still smells.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nicer that plungers made with wood
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier model of this which split in the middle of the bellows after years of use. Having an all plastic plunger is more sanitary than a wooden handled one. It works well and looks nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hausman

customer_reviews.title: Garbage plunger
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because the reviews said it was useful for an elongated toilet, I assure you, it is not, no seal, shoots water everywhere
customer_reviews.author: playsgamesalot

customer_reviews.title: Ok but stiff
customer_reviews.text: A plunger usually has rubber end, this has stiff plastic so it won't make a seal
customer_reviews.author: G. L my name

customer_reviews.title: good idea cheaply (poorly) made
customer_reviews.text: The design of this plunger is really good, unfortunately after only two uses the thin plastic began to leak at the folds and spray water everywhere while being used. I wish it was better made!
customer_reviews.author: Jean R

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this plunger based on a Strategist review in New York Magazine. Thee reviewer was right. This is the best plunger out there.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey K.

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for what I got it for. (floor access drain).
customer_reviews.author: Bill Cave

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Have successfully used twice. Doing the job it was bought to do.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it buy a snake
customer_reviews.text: Good design but with shape of my toilt it splashed water everywhere and wont even seal at all. Dissappointment after all the reviews i read. Id return it but i doubt they will return a toilet water covered plunger. Im sure itd work on a flat drain like tub or sink but not on toilets. Just buy a snake for same price.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Dan

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke in less than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. The handle broke in less than 4 months. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: kiddo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic bulb at the bottom is very hard, not bendable and too big for my toilet. Doesn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sara E Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very effective plunger
customer_reviews.text: We use this all the time and it works so well, very effective.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T

customer_reviews.title: I like these style plungers and love the color option
customer_reviews.text: Who would have thought you could get toilet plungers in colors to match your bathroom decor?!!! LOVE this turquoise plunger! Only thing that would be better is if it had Swarovski crystals on it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mom

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit all toilets, especially those with odd shaped bowls
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me for what I ordered it for, unfortunately, but it does do the job when it can get a better seal, like in sinks/showers.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent B Wilkes II

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The day this arrived I used it on my bathtub and sink. The amount of stuff that came out of the sink was disturbing. The large capacity bellows allow for a strong push/pull of air. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless for me
customer_reviews.text: Useless for the newer toilets with a less-than-circular lower/exit area.
customer_reviews.author: Ky

customer_reviews.title: Works, Takes some Practice
customer_reviews.text: Never spend time pumping and pumping to move the waste, and spray it all over in the process. This thing works. You have to get the angle right, but then all that volume pushes everything down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: dbTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Clears drains fast
customer_reviews.text: Unblocks and clears the toilet without too much trouble, does exactly what you want it to do and sounds as though the suction on works well.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: Broke in two.
customer_reviews.text: did not use for very long & it split in two. I am not any type of hardcore plunger user - it was only for a slow draining shower. Being in two pieces - sent it straight to the trash. :(
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: It's a monster
customer_reviews.text: My last roommate had a plunger much like this one, when they moved out I had to get one just like it as it was the best plunger I've ever had the pleasure of using!
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! My old-styled plunger just wasn't doing it so I thought I'd give this type a shot. It works - every time! Great product, lightweight and does its job well.
customer_reviews.author: NOLAgirrrl

customer_reviews.title: The best plunger I bought
customer_reviews.text: This product is definitely worth the price. We bought so many different kinds but ever since we bought this plunger, we never had a clogged toilet ever!! Excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: OTHER TYPES OF PLUNGERS DON'T WORK FOR ME.
customer_reviews.text: Needed an accordion style plunger. Used this for a clogged toilet. It saved my life... maybe that is a bit dramatic - but - it did save me having to rely on someone else to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It has handled my plugged pipes like a champ. Only plunger I would ever own.
customer_reviews.author: MsMoniH

customer_reviews.title: The Incredible Hulk when it comes to clear in clogs
customer_reviews.text: Pier and simple, I love this guy! No clog is too difficult!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customerterri

customer_reviews.title: Clearly, the best plunger!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a clogged drain, sink, or the disgusting backed-up toilet, this plunger will help you get the job done quickly. Highly recommend you buy two.
customer_reviews.author: kathywithak

customer_reviews.title: Works MUCH better than standard plunger
customer_reviews.text: Works MUCH better than standard plunger. Only lasts one or two times. For me that is a goodtrade-off
customer_reviews.author: New Follower

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: I finally had the chance to try this plunger..It really does the job!! It is faster than any plunger I have ever used.Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: ahalp

customer_reviews.title: best!
customer_reviews.text: I am the plumber, builder, fixer. Hubby is retired Army bomb squad and he can't do messy stuff. I had looked at every Walmart in the area near me and none stocked this product. Shoulda looked at amazon to begin with
customer_reviews.author: kimberly tarvin

customer_reviews.title: Glad that I haven't had to use it much
customer_reviews.text: Glad that I haven't had to use it much, but this plunger has worked wonderfully the few times I have!
customer_reviews.author: H. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: great price and product!
customer_reviews.text: they call this the master plunger for a reason, it's unclogged many drains that other plungers simply couldn't unplug and for a much longer duration. i couldn't be happier with the price and quality of this product!
customer_reviews.author: backpacker238

customer_reviews.title: ugly to look at, but if that water ever starts coming back up at you, you'll be glad you have this monster!
customer_reviews.text: best plunger ever. mega suction! don't waste your time with that useless round plunger. also don't just plunge during 'emergencies' -- i think you should plunge your toilet every now and then -- it's like putting your toilet on a juice cleanse ;)
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: G.T. Water Products, Inc. MP100-3 Master Plunger
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great price, very happy customer! We live in an older home with original plumbing. Read (have to plunge daily). I originally bought this brand back around 9/11 when we first bought our home. Despite daily use and dog chewing, the plunger lasted about twelve years! It is just retired because it's got a sight split in one of the bellows. Unfortunately, I bought a cheap imitator as a replacement because I couldn't find this product at Amazon. Sadly, the plunger only lasted about six months. Thankfully, I found it back on Amazon and hoping for another long lived plunger from G.T. The plastic is strong and sturdy, yet the bellows bend with the angle you plunge at.
customer_reviews.author: Haute Mess

customer_reviews.title: Knock the crap out of the toilet
customer_reviews.text: One push and that turd is history. I love these things.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: It works OK
customer_reviews.text: It's OK. But not any better than any other plunger I've used.
customer_reviews.author: I'm in my shop

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work. The Korky one, which I had to later purchase, did the job.
customer_reviews.author: carelcarel

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Every household needs one of these. This is my second, other was accidentally thrown out. Highly recommend! Great for toilets and bath drains.
customer_reviews.author: Mountaineerfan

customer_reviews.title: Best plunger out there
customer_reviews.text: No other plunger works as well as this thing. I already have 2 in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Lisasoul

customer_reviews.title: Best investment!
customer_reviews.text: Best investment. This thing is great. Make sure you understand how to use it. Do a good search as it is a little different then a typical plunger. Do not use excessive force.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! Sturdy, strong suction, and doesn't require a lot of back involvement!!
customer_reviews.author: SG&H1/9

customer_reviews.title: It worked. All there is to it.! ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked. All there is to it.!! Too large to keep in the bathroom but only needed when in need :)
customer_reviews.author: Schnooob

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, great to have
customer_reviews.text: Saw someone using it and found the same on Amazon. Great to have.
customer_reviews.author: Grace M.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth over which plunger to order because I have an oddly-shaped toilet and standard plungers just won't do. I found this plunger on the list, and it had reasonably good reviews. Although it is fairly cheap, I went ahead and tried it anyway. It is fantastic! I had to angle it to fit my toilet, but the diagram on the paper that comes with it shows it angled. I highly recommend it for anyone who has trouble getting a standard plunger to fit over a slightly angled or oddly-shaped hole.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job fast.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? This plunger is an uber plunger, used by plumbers and it really works, and fast. I have two now and could not run my house full of kids without this product.
customer_reviews.author: P.A. Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Great Plunger!!
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic. I have had one of these previously for many years. I moved and somehow it got lost and so I bought a new one. Just as happy with this one as the last. Some people don't like the ribs as they worry about it not staying clean. Understandable, although I have found using it in a toilet bowl full of water after the clog is gone is sufficient to keep it from having any major odors. That is all the cleanliness I require from my plungers ;)
customer_reviews.author: T. Hemenway

customer_reviews.text: WOW! SUPER PLUNGER! If superman had a plunger, this would be it.

customer_reviews.text: works great. this type of plunger causes less plashing and forces more pressure with each plunge. It also never folds over onto itself.

customer_reviews.title: Gets crap unclogged.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well I highly recommend it if you need a powerful plunger. Trust me, don't get the wood handled ones, spend a couple dollars more for a lifetime of easier plungers.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a Charm!
customer_reviews.text: It's so much more efficient that the old style "Plumber's Helper." A real lifesaver with the newer low water capacity toilets that seam to clog more easily.

customer_reviews.title: If you want a fun looking object in your bathroom
customer_reviews.text: This does not do what it is intended to do. If you want a fun looking object in your bathroom, that's fine, but just know if push comes to shove, this won't help.

product_meta.title: Master Plunger MP100-3 Heavy Duty Toilet Plunger Clears, Kitchen Sinks, Garbage Disposal and, Toilets Fast. Equipped with Automatic Air Release Valve (Patent Pending), Black
feature_bullets: Master Plunger 100, largest capacity Bellows plunger on the market, uses 10 cups of water displacement to clear stubborn clogs.
Prevent water overflow while plunging with this Master Plunger’s unique design automatic air relief valve. Automatic valve prevents overflow in clogged toilets.
Master Plunger - the original bellows plunger, this plunger’s brute force will clear clogs fast and with less effort.
Master Plunger’s tri-level nozzle design gives a better seal in kitchen sinks and toilets.
Made in U.S.A with high quality material, get the best most effective hand held unclogging tool

specifications.Warranty Description: 1 year limited warranty against defective material/workmanship.
